welcome.title: HopeBloom
welcome.subtitle: Your AI-Powered Breast Health Companion
welcome.description: Empowering every woman to know, heal, and bloom with hope. Your personalized journey to breast health, mental wellness, and self-care.

mental.journaling_description: Express your thoughts and feelings in a safe, private space. Journaling can help process emotions and track your healing journey.
mental.journal_placeholder: How are you feeling today? What are you grateful for? What progress have you made?
mental.prompt_grateful: What are three things you're grateful for?
mental.prompt_strength: How have you shown strength today?
mental.prompt_progress: What progress have you noticed in yourself?
mental.prompt_advice: What would you tell someone going through a similar journey?
mental.meditation_description: Find peace and relaxation through guided meditation sessions designed specifically for cancer patients and survivors.
mental.body_relaxation_desc: Progressive muscle relaxation for stress relief
mental.positive_affirmations_desc: Daily affirmations for strength and healing
mental.survivor_stories_description: Read inspiring stories from fellow cancer survivors who have found strength, hope, and healing.
mental.journey_recovery_excerpt: After my diagnosis, I felt lost and afraid. But with the support of my family and medical team, I found strength I never knew I had...
mental.finding_hope_excerpt: When I first heard the words 'you have cancer,' my world stopped. But through this journey, I've discovered a resilience I never knew existed...
mental.embracing_life_excerpt: Cancer taught me to appreciate every moment. Now, as a survivor, I live each day with gratitude and purpose...
mental.support_description: Access professional support services, helplines, and resources for your mental health journey.
mental.counselor_support_desc: Connect with volunteer mental health counselors who understand your journey. Available for one-on-one support sessions.
mental.community_forum_desc: Join a safe, private community of women supporting each other. Share experiences, ask questions, and find strength together.

community.joined_room: You have joined the {{room}} community room
community.safety_notice: This is a safe, supportive space. Please be respectful and kind. All messages are encrypted for your privacy.
community.welcome_desc: Connect with others who understand your journey. Share experiences, ask questions, and find strength together.

footer: ðŸ’— Join thousands of women on their path to wellness

dashboard.nutrition_plan_desc: Personalized meal plans and nutrition tips
dashboard.mental_wellness_desc: Support for mental health and resilience

educational.title: Educational Hub
educational.articles_desc: Trusted articles and scientific facts from leading health organizations, regularly updated with the latest research.
educational.categories_desc: Explore articles organized by topic to find exactly what you need.

category_desc.prevention: Learn about prevention strategies and early detection
category_desc.treatment: Understand treatment options and what to expect
category_desc.recovery: Guidance for post-treatment recovery and wellness
category_desc.mental: Mental health support and emotional wellness resources

educational.trusted_sources_desc: All content is sourced from reputable medical organizations and health authorities.

health_tracker.title: Health Tracker
health_tracker.cycle_calendar_desc: Track your menstrual cycle to know the best time for self-examination. The optimal time is usually 7-10 days after your period starts.

when_to_perform_points.monthly: Monthly: Perform a self-examination once every month
when_to_perform_points.best_timing: Best Timing: 7-10 days after your period starts (when breasts are least tender)
when_to_perform_points.post_menopausal: If Post-Menopausal: Choose the same day each month (e.g., the 1st of every month)
when_to_perform_points.pregnant_breastfeeding: If Pregnant/Breastfeeding: Continue monthly checks, note any changes

look_for.lumps: Lumps or thickening in the breast or underarm
look_for.size_shape: Changes in breast size or shape

exam_record.title: Record Your Examination
exam_record.desc: Document your findings after each self-examination. This helps track changes over time.
exam_record.findings_placeholder: Describe what you found during the examination. Note any lumps, changes, or concerns...
exam_record.notes_placeholder: Any additional notes, concerns, or questions for your doctor...

medications.title: Medication Monitoring
medications.desc: Track your medications, dosages, and schedules. This helps ensure you take medications correctly and on time.
medications.name: Medication Name
medications.frequency_ph: e.g., Once daily, Twice daily, Every 12 hours
medications.notes_ph: Special instructions, side effects to watch for, etc.
medications.empty: No medications added yet. Add your first medication above.

symptoms.title: Daily Symptom & Side Effect Tracker
symptoms.desc_fighter: Track your daily side effects and symptoms during treatment.
symptoms.desc_survivor: Record any symptoms or concerns you experience.

steps.step1_desc: Stand in front of a mirror with arms at your sides. Look for any changes in size, shape, or contour of your breasts.
steps.step1_detail: Stand comfortably in front of a well-lit mirror. Keep your arms relaxed at your sides. Look for any visible changes in the size, shape, or contour of your breasts. Check for any swelling, dimpling, or puckering of the skin.
steps.step2_desc: Raise your arms and look for any changes in size, shape, or contour
steps.step2_detail: Slowly raise your arms above your head. While doing this, observe your breasts in the mirror. Look for any changes in how they move, any asymmetry, or any visible lumps or changes in the skin texture.
steps.step3_desc: Look for dimpling, puckering, or changes in skin texture
steps.step3_detail: Examine the skin of your breasts carefully. Look for any dimpling (like the skin of an orange), puckering, redness, rash, or any changes in skin texture. Check both breasts thoroughly.
steps.step4_desc: Check for any discharge or changes in nipple appearance
steps.step4_detail: Gently squeeze each nipple between your thumb and index finger. Check for any discharge (clear, milky, or bloody). Look for any changes in nipple appearance, such as inversion, scaling, or redness.
steps.step5_desc: Lie down and use your right hand to examine your left breast
steps.step5_detail: Lie down on your back with a pillow under your right shoulder. Place your right arm behind your head. Use the pads of your three middle fingers on your left hand to examine your right breast. Use a firm, smooth touch with the first few finger pads of your hand, keeping the fingers flat and together.
steps.step6_desc: Use firm, smooth touches in a circular pattern
steps.step6_detail: Move your fingers in a circular pattern, about the size of a quarter. Cover the entire breast from top to bottom, side to side â€” from your collarbone to the top of your abdomen, and from your armpit to your cleavage. Follow a pattern to be sure you cover the whole breast. You can begin at the nipple, moving in larger and larger circles until you reach the outer edge of the breast. You can also move your fingers up and down vertically, in rows.
steps.step7_desc: Make sure to cover the entire breast and armpit area
steps.step7_detail: Use the same hand movements to feel your left breast with your right hand. Don't forget to check the area around your armpit as well, as breast tissue extends into that area. Feel for any lumps, thickening, or hardened knots. Note any areas that feel different from the rest of your breast tissue.
